page.title: 02 Farewell: Hamlet and Church
page.content: Farewell is a hamlet about 3.2km N.W of Lichfield. It gets its name from a good, clear well which springs up there. Farewell church has a long history.It was built as part of a hermitage and in 1140 was given to some nuns. In 1527 it was closed by Henry V111. Over the years, much of the church fell down and local people used the stone for homes, barns and walls. In the 1740's the church was repaired and much of it was rebuilt in red brick.It is small and simply decorated. It used to have a gallery but this has been filled in and is now the Sunday School room. The church has some very old furniture, including some choir-stalls with misericords.
